definitions.text: a small cube with 1 to 6 spots on the six faces; used in gambling to generate random numbers
a device used for shaping metal
a cutting tool that is fitted into a diestock and used for cutting male (external) screw threads on screws or bolts or pipes or rods
pass from physical life and lose all bodily attributes and functions necessary to sustain life
examples: She died from cancer
The children perished in the fire
The patient went peacefully
The old guy kicked the bucket at the age of 102

definitions.text: suffer or face the pain of death
examples: Martyrs may die every day for their faith

definitions.text: be brought to or as if to the point of death by an intense emotion such as embarrassment, amusement, or shame
examples: I was dying with embarrassment when my little lie was discovered
We almost died laughing during the show
The engine finally went
The car died on the road
The bus we travelled in broke down on the way to town
The coffee maker broke
The engine failed on the way to town
her eyesight went after the accident
She died to worldly things and eventually entered a monastery

definitions.text: languish as with love or desire
examples: She dying for a cigarette
I was dying to leave

definitions.text: cut or shape with a die
examples: Die out leather for belts

definitions.text: to be on base at the end of an inning, of a player

examples: wine and beer can pall

definitions.text: disappear or come to an end
examples: Their anger died
My secret will die with me!

definitions.text: suffer spiritual death; be damned (in the religious sense)
examples: Whosoever..believes in me shall never die
